runs.comm: length ball, swung and seamed nicely away from Lumb's prod
Lumb is down the pitch to this, but he doesn't get bat onto the short of a length ball
short of a length on the stumps, just pushed away to the off side
short of a length on he body, Lumb is cut in half, as he expects this to seam away. Hits him awkwardly on the thigh pad

gone! What sweet bowling from Kule to draw that mistake. Lumb comes at him again, and aims a big shot over mid on. Kule beats him off the pitch and the ball rattles the middle stump. LEDs light up, Kule is leaping in enjoyment.

double strike! This would have been a pretty decent ball in a Test match. It's full, swinging late, but not too much. Moves a little off the seam as well, drawing Moeen into the shot. He drives, the outside edge is collected and it flies low to second slip. You read that right. Second slip. What a start for Kule.
first runs, and that's a lovely shot. Mathews is full and wide, Hales leans into a cover drive and that's all the way to the fence along the turf.

this one, though in the air, is probably even better, because he had to account for the swing away from the bat, in the air. It's full again, Hales hits it over cover this time, a little squarer than the previous shot,
short of a length on off stump, defended solidly
short of a length again, but this nips back at the batsman. Hales tries to pull, but it goes beneath his bat
length ball on off stump, Hales opens the face and pushes it to point
length ball on off stump. Hales stays back and pushes this back at the bowler
wide and seaming even wider away. Can be forgiven, after a double-wicket maiden
length ball angled across and seaming away. Morgan leaves it alone.

length outside off stump, seaming away again, but Morgan ran at him and just bunted it into the off side. Calls his partner through for a quick single, but if the man approaching from cover had been on target with the throw, Hales would have been out

short of a length, jagging into the batsman, but Hales has not problem putting this away imperiously. He just hangs back and pulls it hard behind square to the fence. Good shot, and good anticipation of the seam movement.
length ball outside off stump, jagging in. Hales defends
full on off stump, and that's a sumptuous straight drive, timed beautifully. He just takes a short shuffle forward and sends it all along the carpet in between the bowler and mid off
off stump line again, but Kulasekara pulls the length back. This is driven to mid off, but he has to go a few metres to his left to field it, and the batsmen scamper through
slower yorker first ball, right on the toes. Hales works it out though, and clips it into a legside gap for one
fast yorker this time, right on the money. Morgan can do little more than dig it out to the leg side. Accurate start from the bowler.
jeez. He has got his radar on full power today. Fast yorker on middle stump. Dug out just in time as Morgan gets his feet out of the way. Do radar's improve if given more power?
another yorker. Ever so slightly overpitched, but that still qualifies as a yorker probably. This is just outside off stump. Jammed out again.

and he finally gives up a hittable one. It's a low full toss on middle stump, Morgan whips this away through midwicket, all along the ground for four. Did well to pick up the bad ball after four good ones

pinpoint yorker again. Malinga is death-bowling in the Powerplay. I suspect this is a plan from SL, to ratchet the run rate up. This is slower, on middle stump again. Morgan is content to just keep it out
flat and wide, poor ball to start. Hales chaps it to cover, who misfields allowing a couple
flat and length again, closer into the stumps, cut away to cover
flat and on the legs, clipped straight to square leg
tossed up on the stumps, Hales pushes it past the bowler and calls Morgan through quickly

super shot, a lot of power in those wrists of his. The bowler tosses it up, and Morgan gets low and sweeps it aerially over square leg for four. The wrists whipped around to get the bat speed into the shot.
full and darted in outside off stump, Morgan crunches it to cover
short of a length on  off stump, this is the kind of stuff he usually bowls in the Powerplay. Hales pushes it to extra cover
knee-high full toss on off stump, but it dips on Hales who tries to swing it away on the leg side. Toe-ends it to midwicket
slower, length ball on the stumps, turned to midwicket again. England batsmen not trying too much against him, despite the asking rate.
slower yorker on middle stump, squirted to midwicket.
low full toss on middle stumps and that's slipped beautifully off the toes by Alex Hales. He's beaten short midwicket, and the man square on the fence on the leg side can't cut that off. Well timed.
yorker just wide of off stump, Hales opens the face and eases this away wide of third man for a couple

that is some shot! Mendis delivers a length off break first up, but Morgan gets low and revers sweeps that beautifully behind square on the off siode. Wrists whipping through again, and it's gone quickly to the fence
tossed up on the stumps, slapped to cover
tossed up again, driven to long off
carrom ball straightening on off stump. hales shuffles across and whips this between long on and deep midwicket for a couple
carrom ball again, Hales stays back this time and punches it to long on

googly on the pads, Morgan has just pushed at this, but that's some lovely placement. About four fielders converge on the ball, which comes to a stop at about midwicket, but none of them can prevent the second run
tossed up on off stump, driven back to the bowler
tossed up on leg stump, Hales flicks this off the pad and gets it between deep square leg and deep midwicket
Hales is down the track, but Senanayake sees him and pulls the length back. Hales ends up punching it to long on
tossed up, straightening on leg stump. Pushed into the vacant legside infield for a single
full, tossed up, this is the one that goes the other where. Hales tries to hit it through leg, but gets a leading edge to long off
tossed up wide of off stump. Morgan chops at it, but hits it straight to cover
Hales comes at him, but Mendis drags it down. Batsman works it to deep midwicket off the pad
carrom ball, tossed up. Morgan makes room and tries to carve it through cover, but mishits it back to the bowler
flat, fired in on the pads. Morgan tries to sweep and misses
tossed up, angled across Morgan, who makes room and tires to smash that over cover again. Only gets a top edge though, and it goes over the infield to the deep point fielder
full and on the pads, just turned into a legside gap square of the wicket
carrom ball, tossed up wide. Morgan comes at Mendis, but manages only to drag it aerially to long on
fullish ball outside off stump, and that's struck nicely by Morgan, who swings his arms through it and gets it high over long on for six. That will ease some pressure.
wide length ball, slapped nonchalantly through cover for four, beating both a man in the ring and the offside sweeper.

length ball, wide of off stump again, but Mathews has slowed this one down. Morgan doesn't pick it, and tries to hit it over cover, and the bottom hand comes off as he lobs it towards long on. Doesn't carry though
length ball on the pads, clipped casually behind square on the leg side for a boundary. Poor ball, that one.
full delivery outside off stump, driven hard to deep cover
full on the stumps, Morgan clips it straight to midwicket
offbreak, pitched on a length. Hales stays back and pushes to short midwicket
carrom ball straightening on the pads, turned away to deep square leg

that is sweetly struck from Morgan. Mendis is not getting much off the surface, Morgan has tried to go over deep cover before, but succeeds with aplomb this time. It's full outside off stump and launched into the stands.
length ball on the stumps, Morgan just chops this past cover for a single
flat on off stump, pushed square on the off side into a gap
bad ball and smartly slapped away. That's short and wide, Morgan reaches out and crashes it aerially behind point for a boundary. England is kicking on here.
length ball turning into Hales, who turns it away to deep midwicket
Morgan comes down, but Sena sees him coming and slows it down and pulls the length back. Morgan adjusts the shot though and bunts it away towards deep cover for one
length ball turning in again, Hales works it to deep midwicket
doosra, turning sharply into Morgan, who chops it away to deep cover
length ball, but delivered very slow, Hales comes forward and cuts to to offside sweeper
this is on off stump, straightening, but Morgan makes room and cuts it powerfully in front of square to beat the infielder. The men on the fence don't have a chance.
short and wide, Hales cuts it aerially but though the third man thinks he's a chance of taking the catch, it falls square of him and goes to the boundary. That's Hales' eighth T20 fifty.
short of a length, closer in to the stumps, chopped away to cover and there's time for a single
full delivery outside off stump. Driven straight to cover
yorker just outside off stump, dug out square by Morgan and they scamper through
high full toss, wide of off stump, smashed past cover nicely to the deep cover fence. That's a poor ball - probably slipped out of his hand

slower ball, short of a length, whacked away square on the leg side straight to the man on the deep square fence, but he has dropped it! It's Mahela out there, he ovveran it slightly and let it slip through his fingers and onto the boundary. He goes off the field. Might have hurt his webbing.
reverse sweep again, and boy he hits that hard. That's slapped behind square and miles away from the square fielder running around. It was a length ball on the stumps.
length ball straightening on the stumps, worked away to leg
length ball turning in, Hales tries to hit it square but misses and it hits his pads
full on off stump, driven to long off
full on the stumps, swept square for a single
length ball turning into off stump, Hales goes back and works this between deep midwicket and long on, and that's an easy two
long hop, but Morgan doesn't cash in. He swipes that one to the leg side in the air, gets to deep midwicket on the bounce
length ball on off stump and Hales connects beautifully to send this high and long over cow corner. No turn, so Hales just had to pick the line and make sure he got all of it.
fuller and flatter, swept square. Thisara Perera runs around from deep backward square to cut it off. He does well.

Hales is down the pitch again, it's a length legbreak and Hales gets enough on this to get it high over cow corner as well. It's basically a short ball and the batsman just goes through with the slog, It's miles over the line

slog sweep now, and this is beautifully hit again. No turn once more, this is full, and Hales gets under it, places it perfectly between deep square leg and deep midwicket and it goes flat and hard, landing about a metre over the rope

I said this was a big over, because this is not a day for Mendis. Pitches it up outside off, Hales drills it through cover and could not have placed it better, That goes between deep cover and long off for four
yorker on off stump, jammed out towards cover to get a single
slightly overpitched outside off stump, carved away along the ground to deep cover
yorker on the toes, Morgan jams it out to long on
overpitched outside off stump, driven straight to cover, so there's no run
overpitched ball on the stumps, clipped away powerfully by Hales, all the way to the deep midwicket fence. The man at deep square leg gave chase, but couldn't get near it
that's slipped out of his hand. It's an attempted slower ball, but goes around waist high near the leg stump. Hales dips under it and it's called a no ball
yorker on the stumps, dug out to midwicket and they take an easy one
length ball outside off stump, Hales flat-bats it aerially down to long on

and there's the breakthrough for Sri Lanka! Kulasekara does it. All three wickets have fallen to him. It's a fullish ball outside off stump, and hes pummeled it straight to the man at long on.  Not sure why Morgan didn't get under it as he'd hoped, he's smashed balls like that for the last half hour. Maybe it stopped on the pitch a little.
length ball outside off, Hales walks across and pushes this into the leg side for a single
length ball outside off stump again. Buttler comes forward and drives it on the up straight to cover.

Buttler comes at Kulasekara, who delivers a yorker on the stumps. He;s squeezed that to cover, who has a shy at the stumps as the batsmen scamper through. Kule doesn't collect cleanly at the stumps and gives away an unnecessary run.
short ball, but too short. That's over the head and given wide

gone! A fourth for Kulasekara, and this one is off a short ball, around stomach high. Buttler backs away and tried to thump it over the straight boundary, but it takes the top edge and it loops to cover, where Chandimal backpedals and holds the catch, close to his chest.

oh and what a shot to play first ball. He knew this would be a yorker, so he backs away and opens the face to get it wide of the keeper to the fine leg fence. Bopara is the finisher. Can he get the best of Malinga?

and again. Super shot once more. Malinga goes for the wide yorker, maybe gets a bit wider than he actually wanted. Bopara reaches out and opens the face again, and that goes even quicker to the fine third man boundary. Lovely hands from Bopara.
yorker outside off stump again, Bopara opens the face agaiin, but can't connect this time
this is the slower one on the toes, slightly overpitched. It's turned towards midwicket for one.
wide, fired down the leg side. Sanga is almost appealing, but he's not touched that.
yorker on off stump, drilled straight to cover. Dot ball.
slow yorker on the toes, clipped to deep square leg. Just the one.
wide yorker, drilled out square on the off side. Kusal Perera runs around to cut it off, and Hales comes back. A better throw might have had him in trouble, but he's safe

Hey OH! This could be it! Is this the stroke that seals the game? Hales walkes across the stumps, so Kule fires it even wider, and it's a length ball, Hales throws his bat at it, and carves it beautifully over cover for a flat six. That's Hales' hundred as well. What a way to get there!
length ball on the stumps, that's smashed high over deep midwicket for six. What a shot! That is sent way, way back into the stands.
fullish outside off drilled towards cover for one
full and on off stump again, punched down to long on
wide yorker, Hales tries to guide it to third man fence, but misses
Bopara runs at him, Mathews sees it, pulls back the length and bowls a slower ball. Somehow Bopara gets bat on it, with a cross-batted shot and it dribbles away to short fine leg

tees off and that's it! Without a doubt, that is the innings of the tournament. Length ball on  the stumps, Hales just waits for it and blasts it into the stratosphere on the leg side! What a comeback this has been! This is the highest T20 chase for England. The England dugout is ecstatic, and why not? Some seriously smart cricket from Hales and Morgan.
